en: After I tore apart that cursed photo, I broke everything that my fist was capable of breaking.
I broke the table, the ash-tray, the television, the rotary phones, and every glass window I can get my hands on.
By this time, the neighbors should've made a call, complaining of screams coming from a once respectable house, screams that may be ruining their sleep.
The neighbors around me were wealthy people as well:
politicians, businessmen, and the general’s press secretary surrounded our house.
It was a house that made Kaede's father almost bankrupt,
and it was only because of my father's reputation, that my father-in-law was even able to secure the ground at half price.
And now it was in ruins from top to bottom, and no police sirens were ringing.
The screams of my agony nearly broke my own throat, and yet, for some reason, they weren't loud enough to break anyone's sleep.
I still remember that I ran around the house, breathing like a madman.
Getting scratches all over my body, chasing voices that weren't there.
Trying to kill figures that possessed no shape.

It was all fruitless, for at the end of the day it hurt me more than anything that could've even possibly shared that large space with me, and yet, there was no sight of any living being that I could hurt.
I screamed when I broke all the mirrors of the bathroom, and cut myself further on the hand.
My eyes were crying at that point, there was no sight of any whiteness left in my eyes,
every strain of it was bleeding...
Something suddenly whispered in my ears, and I followed that noise.
Walking among the broken pieces of furniture with their splinters stabbing my legs, I saw a figure, just at the corner of the upper stairs bathroom.
As soon as I reached the edge of that room, that figure disappeared down the stairs.
My eyes could not make out that shape, but something blurry did walk by downstairs.
I bit my shard stabbed hand with my mouth, and wounds that were starting to heal opened up again.
If I was to hurt whatever walked beneath these stairs,
I was making sure that it would taste the blood that it had made me spill.
It was floating away like wind from my sight.
Now it stood at the edge of the room, and with a blink of my eye, it was gone.
I ran where it stood before, and yet, turned my head left and saw nothing.
I screamed at the top of my lungs and punched the wall near me.
I was not letting this fucker get away from me, it would pay what it had done, and I was going to make sure that it suffered when it paid.
I will make sure that whoever he ever loved, and whomever he ever even touched would die with the same suffering that thing caused me.
I was not letting it get away from my sight.
I was staring at the direction that noise came from, and yet I cannot make out a figure.
I turned my head around, and it was there, standing just right at the end of the hallway.
I still cannot make out its face, but I could tell, oh I could tell that he was taking pleasure in my misery.
I would like to see how that thing smiled when I ripped its skin apart in two.
I would like to hear its scream...
I WOULD LIKE TO HEAR ITS SCREAM WHEN I TORE ITS THROAT WITH MY BARE TEETH.
The lights flickered and that figure disappeared.
I punched the wall again, and the shard deepened in my knuckles.
The wound opened further, and as my hand was up in the air trying to grab whatever was nearby to destroy or mutilate, that blood trickled all the way up my arm and almost covered my shoulder,
until I let my arms down.
My lungs contracted, and staring down at the ground,
I violently started coughing out whatever was inside my body.
And inside my body were shards and shards of glass covered in blood.
My red eyes looked pleasant in them, for then I was able to create a certain disbelief that my eyes were normal,
that was the wrong disbelief to have as I found out not just a minute later.
The scream escaped me with a splatter of blood,
it almost felt like my chest was tearing in two, I could already feel the layers of and layers of tangled nerves snapping and unfolding.
my head shook with every instance of that scream, at points I could not tell whether it was there or not, or it was just blown away eons ago.
The brain had rotted from inside, I know...
I was smelling the smell of my own organs burning.
'I want this blood back, it's mine!'
and without knowing I put my own bleeding hand in my mouth, and slurped up the blood that was dripping from it.
'COFF! COFF!' I coughed out my own blood.
WHY DID I COUGHED OUT MY OWN FUCKING BLOOD!
I WANT MY BLOOD BACK INTO MY BODY!!!!
IT IS SUPPOSED TO TASTE GOOD!
I AM SUPPOSED TO TAKE IT BACK WITH NO PROBLEMS!
IT IS NOT SUPPOSED TO BE TASTELESS!
IT IS SUPPOSED TO BE PURE!
I WANT IT BACK IN MY BODY!
Why was it not going inside my body?
Why did it had to fucking bleed out to the ground?
It looked so ugly down there.
My reflection looked malicious in it.
I am not malicious, I am just a guy trying to live a normal life, and yet, that innocent guy, in its reflection, looked so ugly, so malevolent, so dangerous, and...
I looked it up, and saw that it was standing just there, where I had first seen it.
I grunted, and walked with limping steps,
I was choking on my own words, but my eyes did not flicker even for a single second.
They were wide open, staring intently at that at the very edge of the hallway.
I would not blink on my own, until that thing was blinking no more.
As I limped further and further towards my goal, the voices in my head got louder and louder.
Trickling down the ground, I left footprints on the red substance that fell from grace out of my body.
I was going to make sure that when I cornered it, I will make up for it by drinking the blood of that monster.
YOU KNOW WHAT YOU HAVE CAUSED!
COME QUICK AND I WILL MAKE IT QUICK!'
Those words were empty, I had already made up my mind that whatever was about to happen, was definitely not going to be quick.
I was back in that room, back in that wretched room where they had taken my Kaede from me.
I was not gonna let it slide.
The one I narrate my tale to can see the room, can't you?
Then tell me, do you see its walls breath,
I saw each of the walls expand to almost unnatural size, and with them they carried a sound of breathing.
It would expand so much that I could make out its wallpaper stretching beyond its breaking point, and as I would stare at them, I would realize that these were no normal walls....
they were live skin, and that I was somehow ....
The voice returned, and it whispered near the other door of the room.
I closed my eyes and followed...
...and quickly opened the door, without trying to open my eyes even once, and when I finally did, I was standing in that hall again.
That hall, opened to the other door of the ROOM.
How was I back in that hall!
WHEN DID YOUR HOUSE HAD A GIANT HALL?
I turned around and opened back that door...
It was just like how I had left it, but it was.......
My hair flew up in the air.
Something was breathing behind me again, I turned around, but there was nothing.
But nothing was behind me, AGAIN!
and it froze the back of my head every time it came.
That cold was not gentle either,
it pierced like needles through my skull.
I did not wish for it once more...
I staggered away from the place where I was standing.
This breath was unbearable, and this breathing room,
At the corner of the room,
It had skin on one end, and nothing but splattered flesh on the other.
It was cut in half, with a perfect symmetry, and its red blood was drooling all over the wall.
You want to know something funny,
you could see that this half-chewed body resembled that of a half-an-open mouth.

The body that was left, it was molded and broken into a shape that resembled a lip, the few broken pieces of its skeleton that popped out of that cut apart skin, were broken into so many cracks that they resembled the upper teeth.
ROTTEN MEAT ALL OVER THE WALLS!
And you want to know the worst part of it,
FOR IT IS THE MOST HORRIBLE SIGHT THAT CAN BEFELL ANY LIVING BEING'S EYES!
I closed my eyes, and followed that voice again...
I was in my living room.
painful to hear all these voices.
I did not wish to stand here anymore, and yet I cannot see an exit.
The cold breaths when they came,
And as I laid there in pain and agony...
I could only wish that whatever was happening was just a figment of my mind.
That it was just happening in my brain.
That I will soon open my eyes, and wake up to a world that was
However, I was coughing blood from my throat, and bleeding from my hand.
And as I stared at those two gulps of red that flow from my body,
....that this was no figment of my imagination....
...all really happening to me....and it was happening...
I knew that following the voice spelled doom, but there was nothing else I could do.
All I could do was follow and open the front door...
...was not going to be the outside world.
I was back in that room.
The front door was nowhere near my bedroom, then how come that I was back in it.
I wanted to ask so many questions but...
Now whenever I saw them stretch far and far away, I would see shadows of the bodies trapped inside.
They were clinging at the skin of the walls that trapped them.
My shoulders lost all the powers that they once possessed, and I fell down on my knees.
They all were cackling around me like crows.
Why do crows cackle you ask?
Well, they are attracted to the smell of death,
and smell of anything that bled.
I bled from top to bottom,
and I was a dying one.
dissolving into nothing but a pulp of chewed organs,
and an overflowed pool of blood.
I wonder when they rip me apart, what they will do with my intestines?
Would they eat it last or eat it first?
Or would they spread it out wide in a showcase of modern art:
[i]wrapped around my skin like a fish caught in a net.[/i]
I was out of playing that game.
I wanted whatever it was to just show itself and be done with me.
I was already dying, I wanted to get out of this.
I wanted to die, if I could prick those shards out of my knuckles and cut my wrist in two,
But I was shaking and bleeding already, my mind had lost all its sense of place.
I smashed my head on the floor,
PLEASE, I DON'T WANT TO DIE!!!
I want a human here, any human.
Please, I don’t want to die.
A single sight would be good.
I don't want to die alone, anyone?
'There are no humans in this room.'
and definitely not in the front. Neither was it something that was below me.
It was something that spoke from...
Have you ever seen something so vicious and angry, so terrifyingly bigger than you, that you cannot describe the fear you felt, all just by looking at it.
so detached from the sense of structure,
so horrible in the way it drooled and breathed,
and so unspeakably mysterious in its movement,
The moment when you look at that thing,
...little by little towards you, with limbs that bended in usual directions,
slogging the body that they were attached to,
that this unspeakable horror that your eyes shook to,
you knees shook so much in fear that they touched each other,
and your mind struggled against the friction of sanity that struck in a total different direction of comprehensibility
and the resulting spark started a fire which burned every nerve that was so long holding together your being of existence,
It was born this way, this was its natural form, and it was ready to devour whatever was below it.
And below it right now was
was to wish that it would not hurt for long.
But I knew that privilege was not afford to me.
For the way it moved closer
...that it was going to hurt me...
And I guess that is how I ended here.
That is the injustice that was carried out to me and the ones I loved so dearly.
I can only wish that I could rant like I did in the beginning of our conversation, but the truth is, I don’t feel anything anymore now that I have told my tale.
Still, this is not the conclusion of the tale,
there is still one missing piece,
and it's not for me to narrate.
I am sorry to leave you now to whatever conclusion you are about to see,
but it is getting cold in this, dark, dark, place.
I cannot find a warmer one, and so, I shall move to find it.
Till then, whatever revelations await you, is not for me to see.
I am not even in the same condition I met you earlier,
terrible for me to keep track of what is happening anymore.
I remember that I welcomed you to something,
...it was not as dark as this one.
I remember it was brightly lit,
Goodbye from my end, and in case whatever you learn next, good, bad, or even mildly interesting, do not tell me if I loop around back to you.
I just wish to find something warm.
Goodbye, and in case we meet again, please do me a favor, as told before, do not tell me what you learn next and...
...do not forget my name, because the last thing I want
